episodeTitle: The Insatiable Akainu! Lava Fists Pummel Luffy!
episodeTitleJapanese: 赤犬の執念！ルフィを襲うマグマの拳
episodeTitleRomanized: Akainu no Shūnen! Rufi o Osou Maguma no Kobushi
description: As Marineford crumbles, Blackbeard threatens to destroy the entire island with Whitebeard's stolen power, but Sengoku counters with a devastating shockwave. Meanwhile, Akainu relentlessly pursues the escaping Luffy and Jinbe, gravely wounding both. Crocodile and the Whitebeard Commanders intervene to protect Luffy, while Trafalgar Law arrives offering medical assistance.

events.title: Marineford Headquarters Begins to Collapse
events.description: The main building of Marineford Headquarters starts to crumble and collapse after the devastating battle. Marines flee as the top part of the building breaks apart, with civilians and Marines watching in shock and tears from Sabaody Archipelago.
events.significance: Symbolizes the end of an era and the physical destruction caused by the Summit War. The collapse of Marine HQ represents the Marines' loss despite their victory.

events.title: Blackbeard Tests Whitebeard's Earthquake Power
events.description: Marshall D. Teach demonstrates Whitebeard's stolen Gura Gura no Mi power, declaring he will sink Marineford to its core as a demonstration of his new abilities. The battlefield becomes uneven as he creates tremor shockwaves.
events.significance: First demonstration of Blackbeard actively using Whitebeard's Devil Fruit power after stealing it. Shows his intent to destroy everything and marks his rise as a major threat.

quotes.text: How should I begin using my new powers? I know - I'll sink Marineford to its core!
quotes.speaker: Blackbeard

events.title: Sengoku Attacks Blackbeard Pirates with Shockwave
events.description: Sengoku transforms into his Buddha form and delivers a powerful shockwave palm thrust to the Blackbeard Pirates, sending the entire crew flying. His golden shockwaves clash with Blackbeard's tremor shockwaves, and he delivers a rousing speech to raise the Marines' spirits.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sengoku's immense power and leadership as Fleet Admiral. Shows that despite their losses, the Marines still have the strength to fight back against new threats.

quotes.text: Do not let them escape! We will not allow evil to triumph here!
quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Sengoku rallying the Marines after attacking Blackbeard

events.title: Koby Questions Marine Justice
events.description: Koby becomes confused about the Marines' concept of Justice as he witnesses the continued slaughter of pirates after the war has clearly been won. He experiences tormenting Haki visions as he hears the 'voices' of dying people around him.
events.significance: Marks Koby's moral awakening and the beginning of his Observation Haki manifestation. Questions the black-and-white morality of Marine justice, setting up his future development.

events.title: Akainu Relentlessly Pursues Luffy and Jinbe
events.description: Akainu continues his pursuit of the fleeing Luffy and Jinbe with intense determination. He declares that he cannot let Luffy escape as the son of Dragon, showing his absolute commitment to eliminating this threat.
events.significance: Demonstrates Akainu's ruthless nature and unwavering sense of absolute justice. His pursuit will lead to one of Luffy's most severe injuries.

quotes.text: I cannot let the son of Dragon escape! He must die here!
quotes.speaker: Akainu

events.title: Ivankov Attempts to Stop Akainu
events.description: Emporio Ivankov intervenes to protect Luffy and Jinbe, fighting against Akainu. The scene is extended from the manga, showing more of their confrontation.
events.significance: Shows the Revolutionary Army's commitment to protecting Luffy, Dragon's son. Demonstrates the alliances formed to help Luffy escape.

events.title: Akainu's Magma Punch Pierces Jinbe and Severely Wounds Luffy
events.description: Akainu catches up to Jinbe and Luffy, punching through Jinbe's chest with his magma fist. The attack is so powerful that it goes through Jinbe and burns Luffy's chest, creating the iconic X-shaped scar. Both fall to the ice, critically injured and unconscious.
events.significance: This is the moment Luffy receives his permanent chest scar, a lasting reminder of the Marineford War and Ace's death. One of the worst injuries Luffy has ever suffered. Jinbe nearly dies protecting Luffy.

events.title: Crocodile Saves Luffy and Jinbe from Akainu
events.description: As Akainu approaches the fallen Luffy and Jinbe, Crocodile appears behind him and splits him in two with Desert Grande Espada. He then uses Sables to launch Jinbe and Luffy high into the air, away from danger, and yells for someone to get them onto a ship.
events.significance: Unexpected alliance showing Crocodile's complex character development. Despite being Luffy's former enemy, he saves his life. This moment cements the temporary alliance formed during the war.

quotes.text: If you want to protect someone, you have to do it right!
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile scolding Jinbe while saving them from Akainu

events.title: Buggy Accidentally Catches Luffy and Jinbe
events.description: The airborne Luffy and Jinbe collide with a fleeing Buggy, who catches them. His Impel Down followers praise him for heroically saving them, completely misinterpreting his cowardice. Buggy is terrified and unsure what to do.
events.significance: Comic relief in a tense moment. Continues Buggy's running gag of accidentally becoming a hero through cowardice and gaining followers who misunderstand his actions.

events.title: Akainu Attacks Buggy with Molten Fist
events.description: Akainu launches a giant molten magma fist attack at Buggy and his unwanted package (Luffy and Jinbe). They barely escape the devastating attack.
events.significance: Shows Akainu's relentlessness and determination to kill Luffy at any cost, even attacking through other pirates.

events.title: Whitebeard Commanders and Crocodile Confront Akainu
events.description: Marco, Vista, and the other Whitebeard Division Commanders stand before Akainu alongside Crocodile, blocking his path to Luffy. Vista declares that Luffy is the one Ace loved and Whitebeard recognized. They prepare to fight Akainu to cover Luffy's escape.
events.significance: The Whitebeard Pirates honor their captain's and Ace's wishes by protecting Luffy. Shows the bonds formed during the war and the respect Whitebeard's crew has for Luffy.

quotes.text: Strawhat Luffy is the one Ace loved and Whitebeard recognized. We won't let you have him!
quotes.speaker: Vista
quotes.context: Vista explaining why the Whitebeard Pirates will protect Luffy

events.title: Trafalgar Law Arrives at Marineford
events.description: A voice calls out to Buggy, telling the flying clown to bring 'Mister Strawhat' to him. Trafalgar Law emerges from his submarine, the Polar Tang, announcing that he is a doctor and offering to save Luffy's life.
events.significance: Law's dramatic entrance marks the beginning of his crucial role in saving Luffy's life. This is a pivotal moment that establishes the alliance between Law and Luffy, which will continue throughout the series.

quotes.text: I'm a doctor. Bring Mister Strawhat over to me!
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's first words upon arriving at Marineford

events.title: Polar Tang Submarine Debut
events.description: The Heart Pirates' yellow submarine, the Polar Tang, surfaces at Marineford. The submarine is lined with torpedo cannons and has a distinctive light green underside.
events.significance: Introduction of Law's iconic submarine that will be used throughout the series. The vessel's arrival provides the means for Luffy's escape and medical treatment.

events.title: Happygun Debut
events.description: Happygun, a New World pirate with long black hair and a distinctive triple-pointed chin, is shown watching in horror as Akainu punches through Jinbe to attack Luffy. He appears alongside fellow New World pirates Ninth and Pavlik.
events.significance: Minor character introduction showing other New World pirates present at Marineford witnessing the war's climax.

themes.description: The episode explores different interpretations of justice through Akainu's absolute justice, Koby's moral questioning, and the Marines' continued slaughter after winning the war.
themes.symbolism: The collapsing Marineford headquarters symbolizes the crumbling of black-and-white concepts of justice.

themes.description: Multiple characters risk their lives to protect Luffy - Jinbe takes a devastating blow, Ivankov fights Akainu, Crocodile intervenes, and the Whitebeard Commanders make a stand.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's scar becomes a permanent symbol of the sacrifices made to save him.

themes.description: Former enemies like Crocodile work together with Luffy's allies to ensure his survival, showing how the war created unexpected bonds.
themes.symbolism: Enemies becoming temporary allies represents the complexity of the One Piece world beyond simple good vs evil.

themes.description: Blackbeard demonstrates his new power, Marineford collapses, and new players like Law enter the stage, all signaling the shift to a new era of piracy.
themes.symbolism: The physical destruction of Marine HQ represents the old order being replaced.

characterSpotlights.development: Akainu's ruthless pursuit of Luffy showcases his unwavering commitment to absolute justice, even after the war is won. His relentlessness makes him one of the most fearsome antagonists.
keyActions: Punches through Jinbe's chest to wound Luffy
quotes: I cannot let the son of Dragon escape! He must die here!

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile's decision to save Luffy demonstrates his complex character. Despite being a former enemy, he respects strength and recognizes something special in Luffy worth protecting.
keyActions: Attacks Akainu with Desert Grande Espada
Launches Luffy and Jinbe to safety with Sables
Stands with Whitebeard Commanders against Akainu
quotes: If you want to protect someone, you have to do it right!

characterSpotlights.development: Law's dramatic entrance and offer to save Luffy establishes him as a crucial figure. His motivations remain mysterious, setting up future storylines.
keyActions: Arrives at Marineford in the Polar Tang submarine
Offers to save Luffy as a doctor
quotes: I'm a doctor. Bring Mister Strawhat over to me!

characterSpotlights.development: Jinbe's willingness to sacrifice his life to protect Luffy shows his complete dedication to honoring Ace's final wish and his growing bond with Luffy.
keyActions: Carries unconscious Luffy while fleeing Akainu
Takes Akainu's magma punch through his chest to protect Luffy

characterSpotlights.development: Koby begins to awaken his Observation Haki as he questions the Marines' actions, setting up his important moment in the next episode.
keyActions: Experiences Haki visions of dying voices

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the fight between Ivankov and Akainu, showing more of their confrontation.
The scene where Akainu attacked Jinbe and Luffy was extended and more detailed in the anime.
The conversation between Akainu and the Whitebeard Commanders and Crocodile was extended from the manga version.
A new scene showing the Heart Pirates approaching Marineford in their submarine was added in the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode received an 11.1% viewership rating in Japan, ranking #3 for the week, showing the intense fan engagement during the Marineford Arc climax.
The episode title references Akainu's 'tenacity' or 'obsession' (執念, shūnen), emphasizing his relentless pursuit of absolute justice.
This is the episode where Luffy receives his iconic X-shaped chest scar that he carries throughout the rest of the series after the timeskip.
Happygun makes his first and only anime appearance in this episode, though his name is not revealed until supplementary material (One Piece Green: Secret Pieces).
The eyecatcher for this episode features Monkey D. Luffy and Nico Robin, an interesting choice given Robin doesn't appear in the episode.
This episode adapts Chapter 578 of the manga, titled 'A Gift for the New Era', covering pages 3-19.
The opening 'One day' by The ROOTLESS was described as more somber in tone compared to previous One Piece openings, fitting the dark events of the Marineford Arc.
